- Microfinance Loan Policy Document
** Version 2.0 I Effective Date: 10 January 2025
>>> Old Content: Version 1.0 I Effective Date: 15 March 2022
>>> Reason for Change: Version updated to reflect incorporation of RBI Master Direction dated 10 October 2024, which requires alignment within three months of issuance.
- Approved By: Board of Directors, Cognizant BFS Bank
- Prepared By: Credit Policy & Risk Department
- Classification: Internal Use Only

- 1. Purpose and Objective
- This policy defines the framework for sanctioning, monitoring and recovering microfinance
- loans under Cognizant BFS Bank's financial inclusion initiative. The objective is to provide
- access to credit for low-income households and micro-entrepreneurs while maintaining
** sound asset quality and compliance with RBI Master Direction - Regulatory Framework for Microfinance Loans (Updated October 10, 2024), Ref. No.: RBI/DOR/MFL/2024-25/78.
>>> Old Content: sound asset quality and compliance with RBI regulations.
>>> Reason for Change: Updated to reference the specific RBI Master Direction dated 10 October 2024 that supersedes earlier circulars and establishes the current regulatory framework.

- 2. Scope
- This policy applies to all microfinance loan products offered by the Bank to eligible
- borrowers through branches and Business Correspondent (BC) channels.
- It covers loan origination, credit appraisal, pricing, disbursement, repayment, and post-
- disbursement monitoring.

- 3. Definitions

- --- TABLE START ---
- Term              : Definition
- Microfinance Loan : A collateral-free loan not exceeding ₹1 lakh to a household having annual income ≤ ₹2 lakh (rural) or ₹2.5 lakh (urban).
- Household         : Individuals related by blood or marriage sharing the same kitchen.
- Group Lending     : Loans extended to Joint Liability Groups (JLGs) or Self-Help Groups (SHGs).
** Key Facts Statement (KFS) : A standardized disclosure document that provides borrower with loan amount, interest, fees, repayment schedule, and total cost of credit.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new definition.
>>> Reason for Change: Added as per RBI Master Direction Section 3, which mandates the use of Key Facts Statement for borrower protection and transparency.
- --- TABLE END ---

- 4. Policy Objectives
- a) To promote income-generation and self-employment among economically weaker
- sections.
- b) To ensure transparent and fair lending practices.
- c) To minimize credit and operational risk through standardized procedures.
- d) To achieve priority-sector lending targets.
** e) To safeguard borrower interests through enhanced disclosure and ethical lending practices.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a new policy objective.
>>> Reason for Change: Added to align with RBI Master Direction Section 1.2, which emphasizes borrower protection as a key regulatory objective.

- 5. Eligibility Criteria
- a) Borrower must be a resident of India, aged 18-60 years.
- b) Minimum membership of a JLG/SHG for group loans.
- c) Household income certified by a designated field officer.
- d) No member of the household should be a defaulter with any financial institution.
- e) Credit information to be checked through CIC database (CIBIL, Equifax etc.).

- 6. Loan Quantum and Tenure
- a) Maximum loan per borrower: ₹1 lakh.
- b) Repayment period: Up to 36 months including grace period (if any).
- c) Repeat loans permitted after successful repayment of previous loan.
** d) Group lending: no individual should be jointly liable for more than two active loans simultaneously.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added as per RBI Master Direction Section 6.3, which limits joint liability exposure to protect borrowers from over-indebtedness.

- 7. Interest Rate and Charges
** a) Interest rate to be linked to the Bank's Base Rate + risk premium. The Annualized Percentage Rate (APR) inclusive of processing fees, insurance, and other charges must be disclosed to the borrower.
>>> Old Content: a) Interest rate to be linked to the Bank's Base Rate + risk premium.
>>> Reason for Change: Enhanced to comply with RBI Master Direction Section 5.1, which mandates disclosure of APR inclusive of all charges for pricing transparency.
- b) Processing fee: Up to 1% of loan amount (non-refundable).
- c) Penal interest: 2% p.a. on overdue instalments.
** d) All rates and charges to be disclosed at the time of sanction through sanction letter and Key Facts Statement (KFS).
>>> Old Content: d) All rates and charges to be disclosed at the time of sanction through sanction letter.
>>> Reason for Change: Updated to include mandatory Key Facts Statement as required by RBI Master Direction Section 4.1.
** e) The Bank shall maintain a uniform interest rate structure across all branches for similar products.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added as per RBI Master Direction Section 5.3, which requires uniform pricing across branches to ensure fairness and consistency.

- 8. Collateral and Security
- a) Microfinance loans are collateral-free.
- b) Personal guarantee of group members serves as credit substitute in JLG/SHG models.
- c) No margin money required.

** 9. Borrower Protection and Disclosure Requirements
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new section.
>>> Reason for Change: New section added to comply with RBI Master Direction Section 4 on Mandatory Borrower Protection Measures.
** a) Every borrower shall be provided with a Key Facts Statement (KFS) prior to sanction, which must include:
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Mandated by RBI Master Direction Section 4.1 to ensure borrowers receive standardized disclosure of loan terms.
** i. Loan amount and tenure
>>> Old Content: N/A
>>> Reason for Change: Required element of KFS as per RBI Master Direction Section 4.1.
** ii. Interest rate and all applicable fees
>>> Old Content: N/A
>>> Reason for Change: Required element of KFS as per RBI Master Direction Section 4.1.
** iii. Repayment schedule
>>> Old Content: N/A
>>> Reason for Change: Required element of KFS as per RBI Master Direction Section 4.1.
** iv. Prepayment options
>>> Old Content: N/A
>>> Reason for Change: Required element of KFS as per RBI Master Direction Section 4.1.
** v. Total cost of credit
>>> Old Content: N/A
>>> Reason for Change: Required element of KFS as per RBI Master Direction Section 4.1.
** b) Borrowers must acknowledge receipt of KFS in writing before disbursement.
>>> Old Content: N/A
>>> Reason for Change: Added as per RBI Master Direction Section 4.2 to ensure documented borrower awareness.
** c) Field officers and BC agents must undergo mandatory training on KFS disclosure and ethical collection practices.
>>> Old Content: N/A
>>> Reason for Change: Added as per RBI Master Direction Section 4.3 to ensure staff competency in borrower protection measures.

** 10. Loan Appraisal and Sanction
>>> Old Content: 9. Loan Appraisal and Sanction
>>> Reason for Change: Section renumbered due to insertion of new Section 9 on Borrower Protection.
** a) Credit Officer to collect application and verify KYC documents. Household income verification and credit bureau checks are mandatory.
>>> Old Content: a) Credit Officer to collect application and verify KYC documents.
>>> Reason for Change: Enhanced to explicitly mandate household income verification and credit bureau checks as required by RBI Master Direction Section 6.1.
- b) Household income and debt assessment performed via field visit.
- c) Loan Proposal Form to be approved by Branch Manager up to ₹50,000; by Regional
- Office up to ₹1 lakh.
- d) Sanction based on repayment capacity and group reputation.

** 11. Disbursement Procedure
>>> Old Content: 10. Disbursement Procedure
>>> Reason for Change: Section renumbered due to insertion of new Section 9 on Borrower Protection.
** a) Disbursement only after completion of documentation, provision of Key Facts Statement (KFS), borrower acknowledgment, and training session on loan terms.
>>> Old Content: a) Disbursement only after completion of documentation and training session on loan terms.
>>> Reason for Change: Updated to include mandatory KFS provision and borrower acknowledgment as per RBI Master Direction Section 4.2.
- b) Funds to be credited directly to borrower's SB account or through BC channel.
- c) Disbursement must not exceed sanctioned limit.

** 12. Repayment Mechanism
>>> Old Content: 11. Repayment Mechanism
>>> Reason for Change: Section renumbered due to insertion of new Section 9 on Borrower Protection.
- a) Equal monthly instalments (EMIs) preferred.
- b) Collection through auto-debit or cash collection by authorized BC agents.
- c) Grace period up to 15 days permitted for unavoidable delays.
- d) Delinquency beyond 30 days to be classified as Special Mention Account (SMA-1).

** 13. Monitoring and Supervision
>>> Old Content: 12. Monitoring and Supervision
>>> Reason for Change: Section renumbered due to insertion of new Section 9 on Borrower Protection.
- a) Branch to conduct monthly review of portfolio quality.
- b) Field staff to submit visit reports for random 10% of active borrowers.
- c) Audit Department to verify loan files quarterly.
- d) Any deviation from policy requires Regional Office approval.
** e) Audit trail of loan approvals, disbursement, and recovery shall be maintained for minimum 5 years.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added as per RBI Master Direction Section 7.2, which mandates maintenance of audit trails for regulatory compliance and supervision.

** 14. Recovery Process
>>> Old Content: 13. Recovery Process
>>> Reason for Change: Section renumbered due to insertion of new Section 9 on Borrower Protection.
- a) Soft reminders and counselling for initial delinquency.
- b) Legal action initiated after 90 days of non-payment.
- c) Recovery through Lok Adalat / SARFAESI where applicable.
- d) Write-off as per Board-approved Write-Off Policy.

** 15. Risk Management
>>> Old Content: 14. Risk Management
>>> Reason for Change: Section renumbered due to insertion of new Section 9 on Borrower Protection.
- a) Portfolio diversification limits: No single district > 20% of microfinance portfolio.
- b) Credit Bureau report mandatory for each applicant.
- c) Operational risk controlled through dual custody of cash and periodic reconciliation.

** 16. Compliance, Reporting and Audit
>>> Old Content: 15. Compliance and Audit
>>> Reason for Change: Section renumbered and title expanded to include Reporting requirements as per RBI Master Direction.
** a) Adherence to RBI Master Direction - Regulatory Framework for Microfinance Loans (Updated October 10, 2024), Ref. No.: RBI/DOR/MFL/2024-25/78, and subsequent notifications.
>>> Old Content: a) Adherence to RBI Master Circular on Microcredit (2011) and subsequent notifications.
>>> Reason for Change: Updated to reference the current RBI Master Direction dated 10 October 2024, which supersedes the 2011 Master Circular as per Section 9.1 of the new direction.
** b) The Bank shall submit quarterly reports to RBI on:
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added as per RBI Master Direction Section 7.1, which mandates quarterly reporting to RBI.
** i. Loan disbursement
>>> Old Content: N/A
>>> Reason for Change: Required reporting element as per RBI Master Direction Section 7.1.
** ii. Delinquency and NPAs
>>> Old Content: N/A
>>> Reason for Change: Required reporting element as per RBI Master Direction Section 7.1.
** iii. KFS compliance
>>> Old Content: N/A
>>> Reason for Change: Required reporting element as per RBI Master Direction Section 7.1.
** c) Compliance Officer to report quarterly to Board on policy implementation and regulatory compliance.
>>> Old Content: b) Compliance Officer to report quarterly to Board on policy implementation.
>>> Reason for Change: Enhanced to explicitly include regulatory compliance reporting in line with RBI Master Direction Section 8.1.

** 17. Review and Amendment
>>> Old Content: 16. Review and Amendment
>>> Reason for Change: Section renumbered due to insertion of new Section 9 on Borrower Protection.
- a) This policy shall be reviewed annually or earlier if directed by the RBI or if significant
- operational changes occur.
- b) Amendments require approval from the Board of Directors.

- Approval Record

- --- TABLE START ---
- Version : Date   		: Approved By 		: Remarks
- 1.0     : 15 Mar 2022 	: Board of Directors    : Initial issue aligned with RBI Microcredit guidelines 2011
** 2.0     : 10 Jan 2025 	: Board of Directors    : Updated to align with RBI Master Direction - Regulatory Framework for Microfinance Loans dated 10 October 2024 (Ref. No.: RBI/DOR/MFL/2024-25/78). Key changes include: mandatory Key Facts Statement (KFS), enhanced borrower protection measures, APR disclosure requirements, joint liability limits, uniform pricing across branches, quarterly RBI reporting, and 5-year audit trail maintenance.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a new version entry.
>>> Reason for Change: New version created to document comprehensive policy update mandated by RBI Master Direction Section 9.2, which requires lenders to align internal policies within three months of issuance (by 10 January 2025).
- --- TABLE END ---"}]
